Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2014 03:37PM Wilsie2 wrote: Just joining the rest, wishing you peace and comfort. We care.  Wilsie
Posts.Title: Hospice for me. Chickadee Jac53

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2012 12:23PM Wilsie2 wrote: I live in Birmingham, AL and am being treated at UAB, a fine hospital, but decided to get 2nd opinion for treatment at MDA.  It took me a couple of weeks to get them everything they wanted, but I went and was seen by Dr. Kimberly Koenig, whom I liked very much.  It is a beautiful facility and very well run.  Dr. Koenig agreed with my treatment plan, suggested adding bone strengthening drug and ending Abraane at 12 treatments.  I have peace of mind not that I have been seen at two of the best cancer hospitals in the country.  If I have a drastic change in my condition, I will fly out to Houston to get their thoughts on any new treatment,  My insurance paid for most of it.  Glad I did it.
Posts.Title: Who do you see at MDA? Outfield Wilsie2

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2014 02:13PM Wilsie2 wrote: I was reading the thread, and wondered how you are doing? I had the same distended nipple, and my lump was also 4cm. I hope that you are doing well.  Wilsie
Posts.Title: Found breast tethering while fixing my hair. :o( Spoomsister Roxybabes

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2013 05:24PM Wilsie2 wrote: I am thankful that I have not had any progression for six months. I am thankful that my meds cause only minor side effects. I am glad to have hair. I am happy I have a loving and supportive family. I am thankful for this site, where I often lurk when feeling down if you look for it, there is always some encouragement somewhere from someone. I was blessed with an optimistic attitude, which is hard to keep going the past couple of years So in closing, I hope that everyone has a good day tomorrow, and can find things that they are thankful for . Wilsie

Oh well, I guess this is the least of my problems!  I should feel glad to be feeling stornger and have more stamina.

Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2012 08:08PM Wilsie2 wrote: How long does it take for duck fur to turn into hair?  I am 8 weeks out with crazy white hairs spacely populating about 3/4 of my skull.  My hair line above my forehead is waaay back there, a little scary.  Beginning to see some brows (thought I was hallucinating, at first) but not much in the way of lashes.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2012 09:02AM Wilsie2 wrote: I am moving soon, and have been going through my entire house making give away, throw away, and keep piles.  Its overwhelming.  At one point I was hopelessly in tears, as I packed up precious momentos, figurines, and other items that have been handed down to me from as far back as my grandmother, fo whom I am named.  I was saddended by the fact that I would never unpack them, I just don't have space in my new place.  There is a story behind almost everything, so I have been tucking little notes with them, so that my children would know why some were meaningful.  Then I took a step back and looked at myself-and realized how unimportant possessions are in the scheme of things, and got myself together again.  I rarely break down, and I think it did me good to put things back in perspective.
Posts.Title: Rainy Days and Mondays.... RobinNY LuvRVing

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2014 08:59AM Wilsie2 wrote: I have hip pain, started Last June,kept mentioning to onc, and finally insisted that we find out what is causing it. Orthopedist took xrays, and finds that I need a hip replacement. Nothing to do with cancer, tho I do have bone mets to upper skeletal. I am doing physical therapy now, and getting a lot of relief.  I have found that oncologists are interested in solving bc issues, but not so much other. So, you need to mention it, and keep searching for answers. I also found that I have high blood pressure as result of how many over the counter pain meds I was taking for my hip! Wilsie
Posts.Title: Pain all the time? angiephnx springwatch

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2012 07:59AM Wilsie2 wrote: The Aromacin took my markers down to normal whereas the 14 treatments of Abraxane did nothing of note except cause my hair to fall out and give me neuropathy, it seems.

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2013 07:06PM Wilsie2 wrote: Has anyone gotten a letter from insurance company stating they are not going to cover Ativan unless my doctor gives thema good reason? It's not the cost, it's the principle, my insurance company surely knows my condition. Makes me feel like an addict! Why does everything have to be difficult?

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2014 04:54PM Wilsie2 wrote: Raro, I feel just like you do. I look at my shoes on the floor, and tell myself "you need to take them to the bedroom" but then argue with myself and say " you can take them next time you are going there, anyway". We are only talking about 30 feet! I have put off going to grocery for two days. If my DD didn't come by every week day and pick me up, I would rarely leave. I am having a two week Taxol break, and if if don't have any more energy than I do now, I will ask my doctor for an antidepressant. I'm not at all sure it's just SEs, but I do know I am not myself. Wilsi

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2012 05:26AM Wilsie2 wrote: My onco told me there was no "magic number" for abraxane treatment.  I have #13 of 14 tomorrow, I think usually it is 12, but I took two weeks off to go to M D Anderson for 2nd opinion, and then proceeded with 3 on one off up to 14.  I am a little afraid of when I stop the chemo, I had ascites before I started, and I don't want that to come back.
Posts.Title: Can't take the last infusion. How bad of a thing is this? soleil505 holdontohope

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2014 02:24PM Wilsie2 wrote: I am calling my ADD chemo brain. I have trouble remembering the simplest word or name, and instead of thinking about it I end up saying "you know what I mean" . It's not worth the effort, but I am hoping my brain recovers when chemo is done. Best thing ever... My new "heated throw", like a mini electric blanket. I think I'm cold all the time, probably cause I don't move around much. Even my bad neuropathy hand will warm up. I do try to get out every day, even though it's an effort, but no purpose other than moving around.

Posts.Title: Latest scan - progression. .....really upset reader123 Bluemnm

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2012 08:36AM Wilsie2 wrote: Alesta, My ascities got under control some when I went on Aromacin and then altogether when I started my Abraxane infusions, which i had 14 teratments of over a course of 4 months.  I finished Abraxane 4 weeks ago and am back on Aromacin, and it has not come back.  The ascites was my only symtom of recurrence, and until I got it under control was having 405 liters drawn every two weeks, so I know what you are going through. When I started being able to eat again, it was like I was a squirrel loading up for the winter, and I have gained most of what I lost back.  So now I am just chubby from eating 24/7 for a couple of months-Gotta stop!  They tested the ascites and found nothing.  I had to go to MD Anderson to get someone else to try to find my cancer, and at this point the see slight metastisis on my upper skeletal.  Still makes me stage IV  Good luck with your chemo, may you find relief like I did.

Posts.Content: Wilsie2 wrote: My eyes started going crazy just before Christmas 2012. It was before my recurrence was diagnoised, my only symptom was. Ascites. To make a long story short, my onc does not find it of concern, nor does my eye doctor. I had cataract surgery Oct '12 and have had brain MRI with nothing. My eyes will be fine for a while, but will start seeing double in one eye, at random. I call it "crazy eye". I just wondered if anyone had any ideas. I only wear glasses to read. It's worse when Ii Go in WalMart and it does not like slot machines, at all.
